text: @ELTIreland Giving them projects to work on - have been using a wiki where all Ss contribute. #eltchinwag
@GlenysHanson @TechTeacherCent @ELTIreland Me too. Need to be a meerkat - always on the lookout! #eltchinwag
@EdLaur @ELTIreland Sort of carousel type activities? #eltchinwag
@j_s_mitten @ELTIreland But do other Ss listen? I find they often switch off when attention is not directed at them. #eltchinwag
@TechTeacherCent @ELTIreland Very true but hard with classes of 25 students + #eltchinwag
@GlenysHanson @ELTIreland Observed lesson recently when Ss used the TL but not really engaged. Objs ticked but what else? #eltchinwag
@j_s_mitten @teacher27 @ELTIreland Sometimes want to keep pace so try to make sense of responses more than ask Ss to re-explain #eltchinwag
@teacher27 @ELTIreland Coined by Scrivener and Underhill, I think. #eltchinwag
Is Demand High a method? I see it as getting more out of Ss and challenging your own practices, e.g. will sth work better here? #eltchinwag
I generally like to figure things out for myself as I'm usually lost when I first learn things! #eltchinwag

@ELTIreland Thanks everyone. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland In my context, yes, as internally moderated. Ts pushing Ss to get thr assessments: teaching to the assessment #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland Assessment for learning v. important. Have you tried any of these? #ELTChinwag: https://t.co/vbrezy0KYy
@LahiffP @eilymurphy @LizziePinard But if you have to put a grade, even a 'pass', some Ss just head for that and ignore comments #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur @eilymurphy In my context - achievement = retention = funding #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland Fun 'tests' like quizzes allow Ss to see their own progress and link prior learning with future learning hopefully #ELTChinwag
@LahiffP @LizziePinard Agree - no grades good idea. Need to encourage Ss to take risks and grades can prevent this. #ELTChinwag
@LahiffP @EdLaur Why is it so bad? Intrigued! #ELTChinwag
@LahiffP @ELTIreland True. I like to see if anything's gone in although I realise not all Ss respond positively to tests #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur What about spelling tests? Not specifically ELT perhaps but my daughter learns 5 random words a week. No context. #ELTchinwag
@EdLaur @ELTIreland Me too - when studying Russian I used to try to win the Kremlin badge in the vocab tests! #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I strangely liked tests but I'm a nerd and do well with rote learning. When I have to think for myself, not so good! #ELTChinwag
@LahiffP @ELTIreland Hi everyone - have just put my daughter to bed so inbetween assessments to see if she has gone to sleep! #eltchinwag

How to cater to different needs - ESOLsSs have diverse abilities in skills. Need to plan accordingly #ELTchat
@GlenysHanson You can't go wrong there. Very wise. #ELTchat
@HadaLitim @GlenysHanson I will always be a littlewig! #ELTchat
@angelos_bollas @GlenysHanson If you're just going through the motions to please sbdy, then definitely! #ELTchat
@angelos_bollas @HadaLitim Not necessarily but helps me think how activities are connected. #ELTchat
@GlenysHanson Not required by OFSTED and was becoming a cut and paste exercise. Bigwigs finally saw sense #ELTchat
@HadaLitim Plans help me to stop thinking of a lesson as a set of activities. Not that detailed unless I'm a bit unsure of sth #ELTchat
@HadaLitim True but I can't break the habit. I need to have some kind of structure. Am I too much of a control freak, I ponder? #ELTchat
@HadaLitim Further Education college in the UK. Used to have do one but felt it was taking up too much time #ELTchat
my institution has just done away with lesson plans. I still do my own version though #Eltchat
@HadaLitim @eilymurphy @ELTIreland Work has Camtasia so use that when I can, otherwise Jing or Screencastify via Google #eltchinwag
@ELTIreland I've started to do oral correction as well as make written comments, esp good for formative drafts as saves time #eltchinwag
@LahiffP @aoifELT @ELTIreland Great idea - could focus on collocations, appropriate style, etc. #eltchinwag
Mistakes mazes usually go down well as well - some answers are correct, some wrong. Have to navigate their way out of the maze. #eltchinwag
@ELTIreland Yes, but find Ss need specific criteria to look out for - otherwise correct everything! #eltchinwag
@muranava @aoifELT Set up activity carefully. I think I've been too relaxed. Have had to 'force' Ss a bit! #eltchinwag
@LahiffP @eilymurphy @ELTIreland Use highlighter pens? #eltchinwag
@ELTIreland @eilymurphy Good point! I sometimes I feel I am too much in their face too #eltchinwag
@eilymurphy @LahiffP @ELTIreland Encourage self-correction but draw attention to common errors in class #eltchinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland I like to walk around and point to their writing, looking quizzical, e.g. saying 'Spelling?' #eltchinwag
@aoifELT This term I've set up 2 wikis - Ss add to these in class or from home, e.g. continuing stories. MIxed success so far! #eltchinwag
@LahiffP @ELTIreland Good idea. I sometimes ask Ss to complete a kind of 5-min journal each week. I then comment on the content. #eltchinwag
Have recently set writing report hmk - plan (3 wks), formative draft (4 wks) and then final submission (another 3 wks). #eltchinwag
Hi everyone. Try to do collaborative tasks where possible. #eltchinwag

@ELTIreland A little and often and to integrate it so it becomes part of language learning rather than sth discrete #eltchinwag
@HadaLitim @ELTIreland And helps with learner autonomy #eltchinwag

@LahiffP @eilymurphy @ELTIreland Don't think it's tonal but rather monosyllabic. Sentence stress a particular nightmare #eltchinwag
@LahiffP @eilymurphy @ELTIreland I work a lot with Ss from Bangladesh. They find word stress v. difficult generally. #eltchinwag
@ELTIreland Tend to gesticulate widely and exaggerate sounds, e.g. treading in sth stinky and saying /urgh/ for the / 3:/ sound! #eltchinwag
@LahiffP @eilymurphy @ELTIreland What do you those with Ss who just can't hear it though? That's difficult #eltchinwag
RT @LahiffP: @languageeteach @eilymurphy @ELTIreland Physical response in general can really help with stress and intonation. #eltchinwag
@eilymurphy @LahiffP @ELTIreland Me too and sitting down and standing up on stressed syllable. Worked well with Japanese ls! #eltchinwag
@LahiffP Yes. It doesn't seem to make sense! #eltchinwag
